title: 81x23: Same Particular Matter Involving a Specific Party and 18 U.S.C. § 207(a)
summary: 18 U.S.C. § 207(a) prohibits a former commissioner from representing a client before his former commission in the same particular matter involving a specific party where an individual who was denied relief during the former commissioner’s tenure wished to reapply to the commission for the same type of relief.
